type1.text: Did you assess the strategic rationale and fit for the proposed M&A deal?
Did you analyze potential revenue synergies from the combination?
Did you evaluate cost synergy opportunities from consolidation?
Did you examine financial impacts like tax benefits or dis-synergies?
Did you consider integration risks and challenges in your analysis?
Did you reference relevant regulatory or antitrust considerations?
Did you estimate a reasonable valuation range for the target?
Did you evaluate alternative M&A targets or organic growth paths?
Did you weigh pros and cons of the deal through objective criteria?
Did you provide a clear, fact-based recommendation on the M&A?

type2.text: How well did you structure the M&A analysis?
options: No clear approach, jumped between topics haphazardly
Mentioned some relevant areas but lack of framework
Followed a standard M&A framework or process
Tailored the structure insightfully to the specific situation
Deployed a comprehensive, innovative M&A architecture

type2.text: How thoroughly did you evaluate strategic considerations?
options: Looked only at financials with no strategic angle
Mentioned strategy at high level but did not analyze in-depth
Explored most major strategic factors like market position
Integrated multiple strategic lenses beyond standard areas
Provided sophisticated, nuanced strategic perspectives

type2.text: How effectively did you model and analyze the deal economics?
options: Did not attempt any financial evaluation or modeling
Tried some analysis but with major calculation errors
Performed standard accretion/dilution and synergy estimates
Built quality financial model integrating multiple factors
Thoughtful, robust model with insightful sensitivity analyses

type2.text: How well did you incorporate organizational considerations?
options: Ignored integration and human capital implications
Mentioned culture or restructuring challenges briefly
Incorporated some change management and people factors
Weighed strategic, financial, and organizational dimensions
Provided well-rounded, pragmatic organisational insights

type2.text: How convincing was your final recommendation?
options: Did not formulate a clear point of view on whether to pursue
Recommendation contradicted analysis or lacked solid reasoning
Provided a reasonable recommendation fitting the baseline data
Articulated a nuanced recommendation accounting for tradeoffs
Persuasive, fact-based recommendation with risks/mitigations
